docstr: `TRAILZ` — Number of trailing zero bits of an integer ### Description `TRAILZ` returns the number of trailing zero bits of an integer. ### Syntax `RESULT = TRAILZ(I)` ### Arguments . ### Return value The type of the return value is the default `INTEGER`. If all the bits of `I` are zero, the result value is `BIT_SIZE(I)`. ### Example ``` PROGRAM test_trailz   WRITE (*,*) TRAILZ(8) ! prints 3 END PROGRAM ``` ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also BIT_SIZE, LEADZ, POPPAR, POPCNT
